internal.content:
--- title: About Aspera description: Overview of Aspera ---

DRAFT

## About Aspera - Aspera is a High Speed File Transfer Platform designed to move data of any size, over any IP based network at the fastest possible speeds. - The name Aspera is an easy way of referring to a stack of components that all work in conjunction to bring together the Aspera ecosystem of software. - The most basic way of representing the Aspera ecosystem of software is through the following stack" ![Aspera Stack](./images/stack.png) There are a few key concepts this simple diagram helps explain: 1. FASP is the fundamental layer of all Aspera file transfers regardless of the way in which a transfer is initiated. 1. Aspera transfers are a 'Client/Server' architecture. At least one Server must be involved in a transfer. 1. There are many different ways of invoking FASP file transfers, each designed to accommodate a different type of workflow. You should now have enough background for this lab. Continue to lab prerequisites.

## About Aspera - Aspera is a High Speed File Transfer Platform designed to move data of any size, over any IP based network at the fastest possible speeds. - The name Aspera is an easy way of referring to a stack of components that all work in conjunction to bring together the Aspera ecosystem of software. - The most basic way of representing the Aspera ecosystem of software is through the following stack" ![Aspera Stack](./images/stack.png) There are a few key concepts this simple diagram helps explain: 1. FASP is the fundamental layer of all Aspera file transfers regardless of the way in which a transfer is initiated. 1. Aspera transfers are a 'Client/Server' architecture. At least one Server must be involved in a transfer. 1. There are many different ways of invoking FASP file transfers, each designed to accommodate a different type of workflow. You should now have enough background for this lab. Continue to lab prerequisites.
